intro: Kadsura hainanensis, commonly known as the Hainan kadsura, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aristolochiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of southern China, particularly Hainan Island. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and distinctive, intricate flowers that resemble a pipe or a horn. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
